intro: Sclerolaena tricuspis, commonly known as the three-lobed bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually three-lobed, giving it the species name *tricuspis*. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
